definitions.definition: To fracture or break apart suddenly .
examples: He snapped his stick in anger.
If you bend it too much, it will snap .

definitions.definition: To give forth or produce a sharp cracking noise ; to crack.
To attempt to seize or bite with the teeth , beak , etc.
examples: A dog snaps at a passenger. A fish snaps at the bait.

definitions.definition: To attempt to seize with eagerness .
examples: She snapped at the chance to appear on television.

definitions.definition: To speak abruptly or sharply .
examples: He snapped at me for the slightest mistake.

definitions.definition: To give way abruptly and loudly .
To suffer a mental breakdown , usually while under tension .
examples: She should take a break before she snaps .

definitions.definition: To flash or appear to flash as with light.
To fit or fasten together with a snapping sound .
To jump to a fixed position relative to another element .
examples: The floating toolbar will snap to the edge of the screen when dragged towards it.

definitions.definition: To snatch with or as if with the teeth.
To pull apart with a snapping sound; to pop loose .
To say abruptly or sharply.
To speak to abruptly or sharply; to treat snappishly ; usually with up .
To cause something to emit a snapping sound, especially by closing it rapidly .
To close something using a snap as a fastener .

A video of a person snapping their fingers. Alternative snapping technique To snap one's fingers : to make a snapping sound, often by pressing the thumb and an opposing finger of the same hand together and suddenly releasing the grip so that the finger hits against the palm ; alternatively, by bringing the index finger quickly down onto the middle finger and thumb.
To cause to move suddenly and smartly .
To move or shift suddenly .
examples: The soldiers snapped to attention as the colonel entered the room.

definitions.definition: To take a photograph ; to release a camera 's shutter (which may make a snapping sound).
examples: He snapped a picture of me with my mouth open and my eyes closed.

definitions.definition: Alternative letter-case form of Snap ( “ to send a visual message through the Snapchat application ” ) .
To put (a football ) in play by a backward pass or handoff from its position on the ground ; to hike (a football).
examples: He can snap the ball to a back twenty yards behind him.

definitions.definition: To misfire .
To catch out sharply (a batsman who has just snicked a bowled ball ).

main_definition: ( intransitive , transitive ) To fracture or break apart suddenly .
secondary_definitions: ( intransitive ) To give forth or produce a sharp cracking noise ; to crack.
( intransitive ) To attempt to seize or bite with the teeth , beak , etc.
( intransitive ) To attempt to seize with eagerness .
( intransitive ) To speak abruptly or sharply .
( intransitive ) To give way abruptly and loudly .
( intransitive ) To suffer a mental breakdown , usually while under tension .
( intransitive ) To flash or appear to flash as with light.
( intransitive ) To fit or fasten together with a snapping sound .
( intransitive , computing , graphical user interface ) To jump to a fixed position relative to another element .
( transitive ) To snatch with or as if with the teeth.
( transitive ) To pull apart with a snapping sound; to pop loose .
( transitive ) To say abruptly or sharply.
( transitive , dated ) To speak to abruptly or sharply; to treat snappishly ; usually with up .
( transitive ) To cause something to emit a snapping sound, especially by closing it rapidly .
( transitive ) To close something using a snap as a fastener .

( transitive ) A video of a person snapping their fingers. Alternative snapping technique To snap one's fingers : to make a snapping sound, often by pressing the thumb and an opposing finger of the same hand together and suddenly releasing the grip so that the finger hits against the palm ; alternatively, by bringing the index finger quickly down onto the middle finger and thumb.
( transitive ) To cause to move suddenly and smartly .
( intransitive ) To move or shift suddenly .
( transitive ) To take a photograph ; to release a camera 's shutter (which may make a snapping sound).
( social media , ditransitive ) Alternative letter-case form of Snap ( “ to send a visual message through the Snapchat application ” ) .
( transitive , American football ) To put (a football ) in play by a backward pass or handoff from its position on the ground ; to hike (a football).
( intransitive ) To misfire .
( cricket , transitive ) To catch out sharply (a batsman who has just snicked a bowled ball ).
